content.rendered:
In this episode of mChats, meet Paul Russo, Co-Chief Investment Officer, Global Head of Equities Risk and member of the Office of the CIO. He shares his thoughts on Millennium’s future, advice for advancing your career and how he maintains balance working in NYC.

What is your favorite part of your job?

Working as part of a team of talented, committed individuals who are trying to do the absolute best they can do every day.

What excites you about Millennium’s future?

I believe Millennium’s future is full of opportunity, and the exciting part is that everyone at the firm gets to contribute to writing that next chapter.

How do you know who is a good fit to work at Millennium?

Millennium values deep expertise, comprehensive knowledge and the ability to apply your experience. We also look for individuals who want to mentor our early career employees, and want to grow and develop at the firm.

What advice would you give your 22-year-old self?

There is no limit to what you can achieve if you’re focused and willing to work hard.

What is your favorite thing about New York City?

Working in New York City is great. The city has it all if you want to go out and explore. I love the sheer volume of interesting things to explore, including the great art, theater and food.

How do you find balance in your weeks?

I love absorbing the energy of the city and office all week, and on the weekend, I prioritize being active outside to bring that balance. In the winter, I ski, and in warmer weather, I play sports or   even just go for long walks in nature.
